intro: Hymenochlaena palawanensis, commonly known as the Palawan stinging nettle, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species with stinging hairs. The plant is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. Its small, greenish-white flowers are arranged in clusters and are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. The plant is known for its irritant hairs, which can cause skin irritation upon contact.
